Alex Sanders’ portfolio. Music, design & advanced front-end web development.

  • email
  • twitter

  • Dan Tombs

    Site design, development and co-conception

    04/2013

    Dan creates glitch-based videos and live visuals for the likes of Factory Floor, Luke Abbott and Jon Hopkins, among many others.

    We wanted to create a site that would show his work by reflecting his aesthetic, rather than a straightforward source of graphical and textual information.

    Originally the site pulled content from a live Google search from Node.js – effectively glitching the data on Dan that was already present on the Internet – but it became too difficult to target the results Dan wanted. Instead, he maintains a list of URLs from a Google alert.

    It’s deliberately built with slightly sub-optimal methods (e.g.setTimeoutvsrequestAnimationFrame) to increase the chances of the viewer’s browser glitching itself, enforcing the aesthetic.

    http://dantombs.net

    CoffeeScript, HTML5, jQuery, Yeoman, Yahoo Pipes, Readability.

  • Artirix

    Technical lead for front-end development

    02/2010—04/2013

    We extracted the technology behind Globrix (see below) to create Artirix, a hosted search platform, and the development team tripled.

    Front-end design and development became all about admin UIs, and I became the UX and technical lead on the front-end for the company as a whole, as well as specifically for clients including Dow Jones, Wall Street Journal and Friday-Ad.

    I also worked up some branding concepts for the new company – ultimately though, they opted for something more utilitarian.

    http://artirix.com

    HTML5, CSS3, CoffeeScript, jQuery, Backbone, Underscore/Lo-Dash, Mapstraction, Bootstrap, SASS/Compass, Less, GMaps, Ruby on Rails, Photoshop.

  • Sea Sentinel

    Director and programmer

    03/2013

    To publicise the release of Transept’s 2nd album Buff as Fuck, I made a video for the track Sea Sentinel.

    It uses footage I shot while kayaking off the coast of Vancouver Island, Canada.

    iPhone, VDMX.

  • Buff as Fuck

    03/2013

    Transept’s second album, mixed with Luke Abbott.

    The Quietus loved it, running an exclusive on the video Dan Tombs made for a track from it, and publishing a long interview with us.

    Electronic Sound said“The genius cannot be understated”and Tiny Mix Tapes described it as“akin to pushing your fists into a bathtub full of ground beef”.

    I designed the logo and artwork again. We mono-printed the background of covers with an open screen, but the fine printing was done professionally.

    I also treated the press shots and created a minisite to promote the release.

    http://buffasfuck.me

    Ableton Live, Photoshop, Illustrator.

  • University of East Anglia

    Associate lecturer

    09/2010—05/2011

    Devised, taught and assessed the Online Media & Archiving module in the School of Music.

    The module is still being taught to 2nd year undergraduates.

  • TRSPT001

    01/2011

    I’m one of 3 members of Transept, and this was our debut album. We wrote, mixed and produced it ourselves.

    Artrocker, Word, Mojo, Uncut and Rock-a-rolla gave it ★★★★.

    Artrocker called it“a stunning piece of progressive space-rock melancholia”.

    Total Music said it sounds like“Fuck Buttons jamming with Acid Mothers Temple or Amon Düül ”.

    On the back of it we supported GY!BE, Walls and Islet.

    I designed the logo and artwork. We screen-printed the covers.

    http://dronehenge.com/trspt001

    Ableton Live, Illustrator.

  • Globrix

    Senior applications developer

    04/2006—02/2010

    A property search start-up, with 4-person development team, in which I had responsibility for the design and build of the UI (from a style guide).

    We developed a drag-based search mechanism for Google Maps (the first that we’d seen), and I developed a prototypical endless-scroll mechanism for lists of results and a draggable price range selector.

    Proper web 2.0…

    We struggled with users being able to switch between a map and list and the problems that caused, so I came up with a concept that would enable displaying results by list and map simultaneously, but it never made it.

    I also developed a house advertising style and ads for The Times (thanks to a friendly investor arrangement).

    In 2010 I designed and developed an iPhone app, using Appcelerator Titanium. Unfortunately, the requirement was dropped as it entered beta testing and it was never released.

    It was subsequently bought and shut down by Zoopla.

    XHTML, CSS2, Prototype.js, script.aculo.us, Ruby on Rails, GMaps, Appcelerator Titanium, Photoshop, Illustrator.

  • University of East Anglia

    MMus (by research) Electroacoustic Composition and Sound Art

    10/2004—10/2006

    Awarded a Distinction.

    My composition for 12 airhorns—called Airhorns—opened the inaugural Faster Than Sound festival at Bentwaters airbase in Suffolk.

    Designed a poster and signage for a performance we put on by Tony Conrad.

    Ableton Live, Protools, Pd, Max/MSP.

  • The Cloud

    02/2005—08/2005

    Consulted on a proposal for a wifi-based public composition installation at the London South Bank Centre.

    Created digital promotional material, and designed and built login screens for various hotspot partnerships, including Vodafone and a then nascent Skype.

    HTML, CSS, Pd.

  • Expert-24

    Lead Front-end Developer

    06/2002—09/2004

    Half of a 2-person design and development team, building a SOAP-based Virtual Doctor and health website for Norwich Union.

    Initially developed with a flash client but later re-written to use DHTML and a cross-browser XMLHTTP mechanism (not yet called Ajax!).

    HTML, JavaScript, CSS, ActionScript/Flash, C#/ASP.NET, XML+XSL, XMLHTTP/SOAP, Photoshop.

  • Autonomy / Blinkx.com

    09/2004

    Client-side consultancy and Flash prototyping of video search results.

    The front-end delivery mechanism for Blinkx.com was re-written around my recommendations.

    Flash, HTTP.

  • CD9 Design

  • New Media Industries Plc

    Lead Developer, Designer and IA

    10/2000—04/2001

    Created an FS-based CMS in ASP and designed for the Army Technical Foundation College.

    HTML, JavaScript, CSS, ASP, Photoshop.

  • TheStreet.com, UK

    Lead Interaction Designer and Front-end Developer

    10/1999—08/2000

    Re-joined many of the FT.com project team to take overall responsibility for UI/UX and client-side code on the UK launch of TheStreet.com(.co.uk).

    Led a complete redesign and build, that took revenues beyond the forecasts.

    The shuttering of the .co.uk—due largely to the under-performing .com—was one of the first closures to mark bursting of the .COM bubble :-)

    DHTML, CSS, Photoshop.

  • Razorfish UK

  • FT.com

    Junior designer/developer
    Senior front-end developer

    06/1998—07/1999

    First job from university, creating illustrative graphics for articles on FT.com.

    After 5 months I moved to product development, where two of us worked with designers from Razorfish to co-design a new interface and IA for the site.

    We then coded the client-side of what became the first, recognisable online version of the paper (using<table>and<font>tags).

    Responsible for page layout and site consistency, usability and compatibility.

    HTML, Photoshop, Fireworks.

  • University College London

    Specialised in Plato, Aesthetics and the Ages of Reason and Enlightenment.

    Books, Pens, HTML, Photoshop.
